ircutils.client¶

Also, it automatically takes care of actions in the background, such as:

  • Client nickname tracking. It will automatically update self.nickname if it gets changed by either you or the server.
  • Client channel tracking. It will monitor which channels the client is in, and will add or remove them from self.channels automatically.
  • CTCP version requests. It automatically responds with a proper version reply.

SimpleClient¶

class SimpleClient(nick, ident=None, mode='+B')¶

SimpleClient is designed to provide a high level of abstraction of the IRC protocol. It’s methods are structured in a way that allows you to often bypass the need to send raw IRC commands.

action(target, action_message)¶

Perform an “action”.

connect(hostname, port=None, use_ssl=False, password=None)¶

Connect to an IRC server.

execute(command, *args, **kwargs)¶

Execute an IRC command on the server. For example, to send a raw PRIVMSG command, do this: self.execute("PRIVMSG", channel, trailing="Hello, world!")

identify(ns_password)¶

Identify yourself with the NickServ service on IRC. This assumes that NickServ is present on the server.

join(channel, key=None)¶

Join the specified channel. Optionally, provide a key to the channel if it requires one.

join_channel(channel, key=None)¶

Join the specified channel. Optionally, provide a key to the channel if it requires one.

notice(target, message)¶

Sends a NOTICE to the specified target.

part(channel, message=None)¶

Leave the specified channel. You may provide a message that shows up during departure.

part_channel(channel, message=None)¶

Leave the specified channel. You may provide a message that shows up during departure.

privmsg(target, message, to_service=False)¶

Sends a message to the specified target. If it is a service, it uses SQUERY instead.

quit(message=None)¶

Disconnects from the IRC server. If message is set, it is provided as a departing message.

register_listener(event_name, listener)¶

Registers an event listener for a given event name. In essence, this binds the event name to the listener and simply provides an easier way to reference the listener.

send_action(target, action_message)¶

Perform an “action”.

send_ctcp(target, command, params=None)¶

Sends a CTCP (Client-to-Client-Protocol) message to the target.

send_ctcp_reply(target, command, params=None)¶

Sends a CTCP reply message to the target. This differs from send_ctcp() because it uses NOTICE instead, as specified by the CTCP documentation.

send_message(target, message, to_service=False)¶

Sends a message to the specified target. If it is a service, it uses SQUERY instead.

send_notice(target, message)¶

Sends a NOTICE to the specified target.

set_nickname(nickname)¶

Attempts to set the nickname for the client.

start()¶

Begin the client. If you wish to run multiple clients at the same time, be sure to use ircutils.start_all() instead.

Examples¶

Currently none.
